DOC.brief_summary: 60 elective patient CABG include receive either standard hyperkalemic cardioplegia ( St.Thomas Hospital Solution No I ) cardioplegia supranormal potassium replace 1.2 mM adenosine . Hypothesis follow : 1 . Adenosine instead supranormal potassium cardioplegic solution give satisfactory cardiac arrest . 2 . Adenosine instead supranormal potassium cardioplegic solution give equal cardioprotection . The patient follow PiCCO-catheter monitor cardiac function repetitive blood sample measure release cardiac enzyme .
DOC.criteria: Elective patient Ejection fraction > 40 % Age 4075 No release og TnT CKMB within last week CABG Pure CABG Age > 75 < 40 EF < 40 % Emergency operation Unstable angina Release TnT CKMB within week operation
